sentences.sContent: There was a calendar on the wall above, with large squares around the dates.
sentences.sCn: 墙的上方曾有一本日历，日期框在大方格里。

sentences.sContent: The Christian calendar was originally based on the Julian calendar of the Romans.
sentences.sCn: 公历最初是基于罗马的儒略历的。

sentences.sContent: ...is one of the most celebrated holidays on the Chinese calendar...

synos.tran: 日历；[天]历法；[管理]日程表

remMethod.val: cal(看作call， 叫) ＋ end(结束) ＋ ar → 一年到头对日子的叫法 → 日历， 历法

words.tran: 日历的；按日历的；历法的（等于calendrical）
日历的；历法的（calendar的形容词形式）

trans.tranOther: a set of pages that show the days, weeks, and months of a particular year, that you usually hang on a wall
